page.title: 03NEWS - BARGOED AREA
page.content: Rhymney Valley Express Thursday 4.7.85 NEIGHBOURS FLEE DANGER LORRY The people living in Bridge Street, Bargoed, and the occupants of the Old Mill pub had to leave the street and pub when a lorry carrying 5 kinds of chemicals skidded on Aberbargoed hill on Monday evening. The police said the chemicals would have been dangerous if split open and mixed. The lorry was towed away safely after an hour and a half. DRUGS DEALER JAILED. Police watched a man, aged 29, of Greefield Street, Bargoed taking a package from a stone wall on Gelligaer Mountain. They followed his car and later saw him weighing a brownish substance which was found to be drugs, valued at Â£1600. He was sentenced to 18 months in jail.
